intro: Eriastrum calocyanum, commonly known as the blueleaf eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, blue-green leaves and yellow flowers. This annual plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit and produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
